Manufacturing Equipment Operator (Roll to Roll Converting Press)
AWT Ottawa has an opening for permanent, full-time, Manufacturing Equipment Operator (Roll to Roll Converting Press).
The Manufacturing Equipment Operator, under the direction of the Production Supervisor, will operate a converting machine to manufacture high quality label and specialized converted products
We are looking for candidates who have mechanically inclined and are interested in being trained by AWT Ottawa to develop a career in the manufacturing industry. Eventually, an experienced Manufacturing Equipment Operator will contribute to the development of new and innovative products encompassing a wide range of different materials.
Who you are:

 Mechanical mindset and eager to learn
 Skilled in performing shop math including fractions, percentages and precise measurements.
 Detailed oriented / problem solver
 Good communicator (verbal and written skills)
 Safety-first attitude
 Team player with good time management skills
 Ethical worker
 Experienced operating machinery
 Computer literate and generally comfortable with technology.
 Ability to stand for long periods of time in one area and dexterity
 Good vision abilities: close and distant vision, accurate color perception and peripheral vision
 Ability to obtain Controlled Goods Certification

What are considered assets: 

 Experienced operating press machinery
 Experience in the flexographic industry
 Knowledge of paper stocks, inks and related materials/techniques used in the printing industry.
 Familiar with basic hand tools and inspection equipment such as calipers both dial and digital

What AWT Ottawa provides:

 Competitive compensation
 Comprehensive group benefits
 Paid Time off
 Training opportunities / Tuition refund
 The opportunity to learn and develop professionally with a diverse team in an inclusive organization where everyone can succeed based on merit.
 Open corporate culture anchored on integrity, teamwork, adaptability and responsibility.

Primary responsibilities

 Ensuring high standards of workmanship and efficiency running various products on a laser cutting machine.
 Perform job order review to ensure job requirements are known and understood.
 Setting up / adjusting the press for job runs and closely monitoring machines for signs of problems while ensuring output is meeting set specifications
 Monitoring product quality during production runs by checking it against drawings and established quality standards.
 Taking corrective measures when quality standards are not met and recommending measures to improve productivity, product quality, and safety.
 Troubleshooting and correcting most press operating problems.
 Completing accurately all related job paperwork.
 Ensuring outputs meet production schedules, safety and quality standards, as well as customer needs
 Performing routine press maintenance, safety checks, upkeep and cleaning.
 Maintaining acceptable productivity standards while minimizing raw material waste.
 Following manufacturing and processing procedures, setting machine or equipment controls, carrying out production and inspection processes as documented.
 Ensuring proper use of required personal protective equipment at all times.
 Maintaining a clean working area free from dirt and debris between tasks and at end of day
 Communicating with Supervisor, Lead Hand, Quality Assurance, as needed for any issue that arises during production.
 Assisting R&D and Production teams in researching and developing new applications.
